result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee J. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit granted.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

supervisions.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:34 PM: Defendant Lee J. Thompson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by SPD w/argued terms on penalty.  DA and Def agree with SPD's recital.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds/Treatment serving no impairment on proceeding today.   Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - no claim for Restitution.  Plea Ct 1:  NC  Plea Ct 2:  NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 3 DRI   Repeater components attached to Ct 1 and 2 dismissed.  Argument by DA - honors Def's wishes against supervision and makes a direct jail time argument.  Argument by SPD - argues for lesser WCJ being imposed.   Statement by Def:   None offered.  The Court:  Speaks with Def as to his wishes against supervision.  The Court will honor Def's wishes as to supervision.   As to Ct No 1:  1 yr WCJ - 90 days TS Credit - Huber and GT - serve forthwith and to contine.  As to Ct No 2:  8 mos WCJ concurrent to Ct 1 - Huber GT and 90 days TS credit.  Costs plus DNA surcharge.  Sample to be provided unless determined sample previously provided.  Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case Called @ 1:26 PM:  Defendant Lee J. Thompson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in its entirety.  Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.   Probable Cause found as to felony count in Complaint - Ct 1.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP as to all 3 counts.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:20 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars except to be present at his residence or to work at the Golden Nugget in Pine River, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any dangerous weapons.

Case called @ 1:01 p.m. Defendant Lee J. Thompson in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi. Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting lower cash bond or signature bond.  Court orders $1000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
